intro: Blaeria gracilis, commonly known as the slender blaea, is a delicate flowering plant native to the temperate regions of the southern hemisphere. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its slender stems and narrow leaves contribute to its graceful appearance. Blaeria gracilis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is appreciated in gardens for its subtle beauty.
